sentences.en: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.cn: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.en: "That money's mine."— 'Of course it is. and quite right too.'
sentences.cn: “那笔钱是我的。”——“当然是你的，而且也理应如此。”

sentences.en: A gold mine is not a bottomless pit, the gold runs out.
sentences.cn: 金矿并非无底的宝藏，金子终究会被采光。

sentences.en: Copper has been mined here since the sixteenth century.
sentences.cn: 从16世纪起这里就开始开采铜矿。

sentences.en: Evelyn's career is accelerating, and mine is plateauing out a bit.
sentences.cn: 伊夫琳的职业生涯蒸蒸日上，而我的则停滞不前。

sentences.en: He called out to them to watch out for the unexploded mine.
sentences.cn: 他冲他们大喊，叫他们小心哑雷。

sentences.en: Her eyes seemed to bore a hole in mine.
sentences.cn: 她的目光似乎要把我的眼睛看穿。

sentences.en: His English is better than mine.
sentences.cn: 他英语比我好。

sentences.en: I shall have words with these stupid friends of mine!
sentences.cn: 我真应该跟我这些愚蠢的朋友理论理论！

sentences.en: I'm looking for a friend of mine who lives here.
sentences.cn: 我正在寻找一位住在这里的朋友。

sentences.en: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.cn: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.en: Mr Brownson, I assure you King's an old enemy of mine.
sentences.cn: 布朗森先生，我向你保证金是我的老冤家。

sentences.en: one of the largest coal mines in the country
sentences.cn: 该国最大的煤矿之一

sentences.en: She tells me her troubles. I tell her mine.
sentences.cn: 我和她互相倾诉烦恼。

sentences.en: The mine reportedly had an accident rate triple the national average.
sentences.cn: 据报道，该矿事故发生率是全国平均水平的3倍。

sentences.en: The night shift should have been safely down the mine long ago.
sentences.cn: 上夜班的矿工应该早就安全地到达井下了。

sentences.en: The programme was a gold mine for small production companies.
sentences.cn: 这一方案能为产量较小的公司带来滚滚财源。

sentences.en: They learnt how to lay mines (= put them in place ) .
sentences.cn: 他们学习了如何布雷。

sentences.en: This area has been mined for over 300 years.
sentences.cn: 这个地区采矿已经有300多年了。

sentences.en: Though mine safety has much improved, miners' families still fear the worst.
sentences.cn: 尽管矿井的安全状况有了很大改善，矿工的家属仍然害怕最糟的情况会发生。

sentences.en: Tom's house is actually in better nick than mine.
sentences.cn: 说实在的，汤姆家房子的状况比我家的强。

sentences.en: You take care of your end, kid, I'll take care of mine.
sentences.cn: 你管好你的事，孩子，我会管好我的。

sentences.en: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.cn: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

words.tran_cn: 矿物；（英）矿泉水；无机物；苏打水（常用复数表示）
使成矿（mineralize的过去式和过去分词）
使含无机化合物；使矿物化
矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷

phrases.tran_cn: 酸性矿水排水；排泄酸性矿水

trans.tran_en: a deep hole or holes in the ground that people dig so that they can remove coal, gold, tin etc
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself
to dig large holes in the ground in order to remove coal, gold etc

trans.tran_cn: 在…中[下]布雷，以地雷[水雷]炸毁
